lines.text: Like a blind man at an orgy, I was going to have to feel things out.

[at a Sperm Bank and Fertility Clinic, unbeknownst to Frank, who's faking an old football injury]
When did you first notice the problem?
In the backyard, with my uncle.
In the backyard... with your uncle?
Yes, when he comes over we like to go out in the backyard and throw it around for a while.
And what did you and your uncle find out?
Oh, I can't keep up with him, mine hurt especially on the long ones. I can't seem to straighten it out, it has no feeling, it's... it's kind of numb. I may have yanked it too much, maybe.

[hands him a cup and opens a door to another room]
If you would.
For what?
A sperm count.
In here?
Well, it's not exactly the backyard, but it'll do.
[Frank Drebin is stopped at the entrance to the Oscars]
Sergeant Frank Drebin, Detective Lieutenant, Police Squad.
Yeah, and I'm Robert De Niro.
Mr. De Niro, we've got to get inside.
Like a midget at a urinal, I was going to have to stay on my toes.
You just watch your step, McGurke. This place here changes a man.
Yeah? In what way?
I used to be white. I was the drummer for the Osmonds.
Screw around with me, and Tyrone here will make you feel pain that you'd never belive.
Yeah, I remember the Osmonds.
My people are very upset.
They're always upset. They're Arab terrorists.
You're all man. I like that in my men.
You're coming on to me big time, sister. You're preying on me like a kitten with a fresh mouse. And we got a problem.
You're Jewish?
No. You're Rocko's girl, and in my book that chapter's called "look but don't touch."
I could have two lovers.
Kinky. But I like my sex the way I play basketball, one on one with as little dribbling as possible.
There's only one way to find out where Rocco's gonna strike next. We're gonna hafta send someone into Statesville Prison.
I'll do it.
Frank, I couldn't. I wouldn't feel right about that. If Rocco finds out you're a cop, you might end up dead!
You might end up dead is my middle name.
What about Jane?
I don't know her middle name. But, Ed, I need the action. I'm going inside the big house.
What's that?
It looks like Phil Donahue throwing up into a tuba.
We heard about you and Jane.
Jane, Jane. That name will always remind me of her.

[at marriage counselling]
You came highly recommended by our last therapist.
Yes, I was sorry to hear about his suicide.
[Frank and Jane approach the first cab with an Arabic driver]
Does that radio work?
[replies in Arabic]
[they move to a second cab with a Jamaican driver]
Call Police Squad! Tell 'em Frank Drebin says...
[replies in Jamaican]
[they move to a third cab with an African driver]
Forget it.
[they immediately leave]

[British accent]
I wonder what the devil he wanted!
[in the prison cafeteria]

Hey! You call this slop? Real slop has got chunks of things in it! This is more like gruel! And this Château le Blanc '68 is supposed to be served slightly chilled! This is room temperature! What do you think we are? Animals?
NO!
What are we?
[the entire hall is silent]
Homo sapiens?
You're right! We're men! We are men!

[all chant]
WE ARE MEN! WE ARE MEN! WE ARE MEN!
[Frank offers Tanya a cigarette]
Cigarette?
Yes, I know.
Where's your prison number?
It's unlisted.

Well... We shot a lot of people together. It's been great. But today I retire, so if I do any shooting now, it'll have to be within the confines of my own home. Hopefully, an intruder and not an in-law, like at my bachelor party.
They're going to blow that place sky high. It'll be a tragedy. Unless it's during a dance number.

[to Rocco]
You are supposed to be the world's foremost terrorist bomber. Airlines, government buildings...
The devastation in South Florida.
That was Hurricane Andrew.
That's what they told the public.

[fires a gun over the heads of the audience]
Freeze, and nobody gets hurt!
[a grip falls from the rafters into the orchestra]
Well, from now on!

[slightly irked after Frank, undercover as Phil Donahue, throws up in a tuba]
Someone make a note. I don't think we should have Phil Donahue back next year.
What are you doing?
Oh! I was, uh, just conjugating my next move.
Your bishop's exposed.
It's these pants.
[Jane catches Frank kissing Tanya]
How could you!
Well, you just shove your tongue as far down his throat as you can.
Mrs. Dillon, your son is a ruthless, cold-blooded, sadistic animal. You must be proud of him.
I am.
How's my little boy? Getting along OK, sweetie?
As well as a heterosexual can in prison. I don't know how much longer I can take it. How's Tanya?
Tanya's the same. Milky, creamy skin, pouting red lips, firm buttocks, ample breasts, ears you want to stick your tongue into.
Ma, please. I'm gonna get guy cramps if you keep this up.
Cheer up, Ed. This is not goodbye. It's just I won't ever see you again.
You haven't shot anybody in six months.
That's true. Funny how you miss the little things.
Jane...
Frank, are you thinking what I'm thinking?
Yes! Florence Henderson's gonna win it, and it's about time.
No! The bomb is in one of those envelopes!
You're right!
Now I know why Ed's been calling every half hour. You've been back on a case, haven't you?
No, no, I swear, it's another woman.
In your wildest dreams.
You know, I feel it's important to get off on the right foot and not get caught up in blame. Now, which one of you is impotent?
Uh, that would be him.
Why don't you ask who's frigid?
Uh, that would be him also.
Any last words before I throw you off?
Yes. Don't do it.
Do you have "Spartacus"?

Uh, Raquel, just a second, I just had a thought. This show is being seen all over the world. I was thinking, if we could all just send good thoughts, transmit them through these cameras here, to the elected leader of China, Wing Wa Woo Tong, so that they might finally be nice. Thank you.
[applause]
And the winner is...

Uh Raquel, so many go to bed hungry in this nation, yet cat food is full of tuna! I can't help but think each time I go to the zoo and see those porpoises, crammed into those tiny tanks, what a waste that is. Butcher half of them now! That's hundreds of pounds of dolphin meat that can be fed to our cats, freeing up that tuna for our nation's hungry.
[few people clap]
And the winner is...
Uh, so many are cold, shivering in the night, so I say, butcher those cats, skin them! Use their fur to keep hundreds warm!

[shocked]
Jesus, Phil!
[Big Con drops a bar of soap in the prison shower room]
Bend over and pick it up for me, would you lover?
Sure. No problem.
[Bends over. His towel falls off, revealing cast iron underwear]

[before Jane leaves]
Look, baby. I am what I am, and I do what I do. A few guys make shoelaces, some lay sod, others make a very good living neutering animals. I'm a cop!
[during prison riot]
I've been watching you McGurke. You handle yourself really good.
Really well.
Whatever.

[Narrating]
Rocco could tell from my little escapade in the shower that I was well endowed... with courage.
